7 Portes was a great experience.  There were no reservations left for the day so we came by and waited and were sat within 20 minutes.  It was a Tuesday, though, so I imagine it would be longer nearer the weekend.  The service staff was great, they only forgot to bring our wine, but they fixed it quickly.  The food was incredible.  I was adamant that I would not try the Sea Snails, but the table ordered them anyway.  I ended up eating 5 or 6 of them...incredible.  We also shared the Tuna Tartare with avocado which was a daily special and it was very fresh and delicious.  Two of us ordered the plate of grilled fish and everything was prepared perfectly.  I ordered the Canalons 7 Portes and was not disappointed.  The meat flavor made me so happy, I wanted to order another plate but refrained.  The least incredible dish was the seafood paella which still wasn't bad.  We ate most of it and the seafood in it was great.We sat at a table that Gabriel Garcia Marquez sat at.  I would definitely recommend a visit to 7 Portes if you have the money, it isn't cheap.  You will be dining in a restaurant that is a historical fixture of Barcelona.  It's more than just good food, it's an experience.  Enjoy!
